text: The 2019–20 Panathinaikos season is the club's 61st consecutive season in Super League Greece. They are also competing in the Greek Cup. ==Transfers== ===In=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Date !Pos. !Name !From !Fee ! |- |12 July 2019 |FW | Christian Konan |Free agent |Free Transfer | |- |18 July 2019 |MF | Dimitris Kolovos | Omonia |Free Transfer | |- |5 August 2019 |DF | João Nunes | Lechia Gdańsk |Free Transfer | |- |23 July 2019 |FW | Yohan Mollo | Sochaux |Free Transfer | |- |13 August 2019 |FW | Uffe Bech | Hannover 96 |Free Transfer | |- |28 August 2019 |FW | Juan José Perea | FC Porto U19 |Free Transfer | |- |29 August 2019 |DF | Bart Schenkeveld | Melbourne City FC |Free Transfer | |- |12 September 2019 |MF | Fausto Tienza | Extremadura UD |Free Transfer | |} ===Loans In=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Date !Pos. !Name !From ! |- |- |23 July 2019 |MF | Ghayas Zahid | APOEL | |} ===Out=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Date !Pos. !Name !To !Fee ! |- |rowspan="15"|30 June 2019 |MF | Ergys Kaçe | PAOK |End of Loan | |- |DF | Ousmane Coulibaly | Al- Wakrah |Free | |- |DF | Konstantinos Valmas | Veria |Free | |- |MF | Christos Kountouriotis | Zemplín Michalovce |Free | |- |MF | Dimos Chantzaras | Veria |Free | |- |MF | Omri Altman | Hapoel Tel Aviv |Free | |} ===Loans Out=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Date !Pos. !Name !T ! |- |- |15 July 2019 |FW | Mark Sifneos | Apollon Larissa | |- |16 August 2019 |MF | Adriano Skenterai | Ethnikos Piraeus | |} ==Team kit== {| | | | | | | |} == Competitions == === Super League Greece === ====League table==== ====Matches==== == References == == External links == Category:Panathinaikos F.C. seasons Panathinaikos
